alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 20 at 3:48AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Flash Flooding on burn scar areas such as the McBride Fire and Bear Trap Fire. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, Eastern Lincoln County, Lower Rio Grande Valley, San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands, South Central Highlands, South Central Mountains and Upper Tularosa Valley. In west central New Mexico, Southwest Mountains. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High moisture content in the atmosphere along with day time heating will allow for thunderstorms to develop capable of producing heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Flash Flooding on burn scar areas such as the McBride Fire and Bear Trap Fire. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, Eastern Lincoln County, Lower Rio Grande Valley, San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands, South Central Highlands, South Central Mountains and Upper Tularosa Valley. In west central New Mexico, Southwest Mountains. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moisture will increase more on Tuesday with an upper level disturbance moving over the region which will support widespread thunderstorm activity capable of heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley
